newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian paras in Congo to start coming home.
newsitem.headline: Belgian paras in Congo to start coming home.

text.p: Belgium will start bringing its troops home from Brazzaville and Congo's Pointe Noire port on Sunday, one week after Laurent Kabila ousted Zaire's President Mobutu Sese Seko, a Defence Ministry spokesman said on Friday.
"The plan is that Sunday half of the people are coming back, and before the end of that week the rest will return," Colonel Ronnie van den Brolle told Reuters.
Equipment would be returned later by sea, he said.

Belgium, the former colonial power in the newly-named Democratic Republic of Congo, formerly Zaire, sent 750 paratroops and support staff to Brazzaville earlier this year to protect and evacuate the 1,500 Belgian nationals in Kinshasa if necessary.
Defence Minister Jean-Pol Poncelet said on Monday he would bring his troops home as soon as possible, as the main direct threat to Belgian nationals had ended.

Belgium, which has de facto recognised Kabila, self-declared president of the new Congo, and his new government, on Friday sent special envoy Yves Haesendonck to Kinshasa to meet Kabila and his ministers.
